DataElement.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Negation Occurrence Reason ISO21090.DSET.SC.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed study level administrative activity that is independent of a study subject. EXAMPLE(S): IRB Approval, site enrollment, FDA audit. The text and/or code that describes the rationale behind why an activity is not done.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Negation Occurrence Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
